articles.title: Kim Jong Il Inspects Industrial Establishments
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Inspects Industrial Establishments
 Pyongyang, March 10 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il gave field guidance to industrial establishments in Huichon City seething with the drive for a great revolutionary surge.
					 The first leg of his guidance was the Chilsong Electric Appliances Factory put on modern lines.
					
					 Going round the pipe shop and other places of the factory, he acquainted himself in detail with the technological updating and production there.
					
					 Greatly satisfied to learn that the officials, workers and technicians of the factory have put the production processes on a modern and scientific basis by their own efforts and with their own technology and rapidly improved the quality of electric appliances through a widespread technical innovation movement, he highly appreciated their feats. 
					
					 Noting that the factory has an important role to play in the nation's economic development, he set forth important tasks to be fulfilled by it. 
					
					 The next leg of his guidance was the Huichon Ceramic Factory.
					
					 After being briefed on the production there, he went round the fire brick production process built by the factory itself to learn about the research and development. 
					
					 He highly estimated the successes made by the officials, technicians and workers of the factory, expressing great satisfaction over the fact that they have established a fire brick production system depending on locally available raw materials by displaying extraordinary creative ingenuity. 
					
					 The production bases built by us with much effort are substantially contributing to the economic development and the improvement of the people's stand of living, he said, adding that the WPK's plan for bringing about a decisive turn in improving the people's standard of living is sure to be successfully materialized as there is the powerful independent economic foundation equipped with the latest technology.
					
					 Noting that the factory has an important role to play in implementing the people's living-first policy, he indicated the tasks to be carried out by it.
					
					 The third leg of his guidance was the Huichon General Machine-Tool Plant where all its production processes have been successfully put on a CNC basis of Korean style.
					
					 He made the rounds of the new casting shop and the newly manufactured machine tools to acquaint himself in detail with its construction and production.
					
					 The workers of the plant have put the machine-building industry on the world's  level by dint of their persevering will as befitting the creators of the Kanggye spirit, he said, adding it is another shining victory won in the era of Songun that the DPRK firmly holds supremacy in CNC technology.
					
					  Noting that the pioneer of cutting-edge technology in the present era of knowledge-based economy is a conqueror and victor in the future, he underscored the need for all the fields and units to dynamically accelerate modernization based on the latest science and technology under the slogan "Let us push back the frontiers of science and technology in all the sectors of the building of a great, prosperous and powerful country and leap higher and faster!".
					
					 He stressed that if the most revolutionary ideology in the DPRK is combined with the cutting-edge science and technology and its army equipped with them, great changes will take place in the revolution and construction and it will turn into an invincible power and prospering genuine people's paradise.
					
					 Noting that the role of the plant is important for developing the nation's machine-building industry, he put forward the important tasks to be fulfilled by it.
					
					 The plant should continue dashing ahead to attain higher goals of science and technology on the basis of the achievements made in placing its production processes on a CNC basis, he said, setting the target to be attained by it in the near future and specifying the orientation and ways to do so.
					
					He earnestly called upon the workers of the plant to give full play to the patriotic devotion to bring about a great boost in the production of machine tools so that the shouts of "Long Live 10,000 CNC Machine Tools!" may resound at the plant in the near future where the shouts of "Long Live 10,000 Machine Tools!" rang out in the past.
					
					 After providing his field guidance to the above-said industrial establishments, he went round the Kumsugol Revolutionary Site in Taehung-dong, Huichon City.
					
					 The site is a historic place where President Kim Il Sung indicated the orientation of the development of the nation's machine-building industry and unrolled a far-reaching plan to develop the Huichon Precision Machine Plant, staying there on Feb. 26 and 28, 1953 during the grim Fatherland Liberation War.
					
					 Being briefed on the site by a lecturer, he went round with deep emotion the historic buildings preserved in their original state.
					
					 Noting that the President was a peerlessly great man who unrolled with his clairvoyant wisdom and foresight a blueprint for the morrow of the triumphed country already in the days of the hard-fought war, he earnestly called for successfully accomplishing the cause of building a thriving nation and thus translating the President's lifelong desire into a reality as soon as possible.
					
					 He was accompanied by Pak To Chun, chief secretary of the Jagang Provincial Committee of the WPK, Kim Kyong Hui and Jang Song Thaek, department directors of the C.C., the WPK, and Ju Kyu Chang, Ri Je Gang and Ri Jae Il, first vice department directors of the C.C., the WPK.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Congratulates Togolese President
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Congratulates Togolese President
 Pyongyang, March 10 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Tuesday sent a congratulatory message to Faure Essozimna Gnassingbe upon his reelection as Togolese president.
					 In the belief that the traditional ties of friendship and cooperation between the DPRK and Togo would grow stronger in the days ahead, the message wished him greater success in his work for achieving the stability and development of the country.

articles.title: 1st Board Meeting of Development Bank
articles.content:
1st Board Meeting of Development Bank
 Pyongyang, March 10 (KCNA) -- The first meeting of the Board of Directors of the State Development Bank took place at Yanggakdo International Hotel on Wednesday.
					 It was attended by directors of the board of the bank and officials concerned as observers.
					
					 Conveyed there was a decision of the DPRK National Defence Commission "On establishing the State Development Bank."
					
					 The board of directors is made up of representatives of the NDC of the DPRK, the Korea Asia-Pacific Peace Committee, an office concerned of the DPRK, the Ministry of Finance, the Korea Taepung International Investment Group and two independent directors.
					
					 At the meeting Jon Il Chun, representative of the DPRK NDC, was elected director-general of the board of the bank and Pak Chol Su, a Korean resident in China, deputy director-general of the board of the bank. 
					
					 The meeting discussed and decided the draft statute of the State Development Bank, the proposal for operating the bank and its draft financial budget for Juche 99 (2010), the statute of its experts committee and the proposal for its management structure.
					
					 Having advanced banking rules and system for transactions with international monetary organizations and commercial banks, the State Development Bank will operate as a comprehensive financial institution making investment in major projects, pursuant to the state policy, and performing the function as a commercial bank.

articles.title: Women's Art Performance Given
articles.content:
Women's Art Performance Given
 Pyongyang, March 10 (KCNA) -- An art performance of the 17th National Women's Union Art Festival was given at the Pyongyang Grand Theatre from Mar. 7 to 9.
					 The performers fully displayed their artistry cultivated through brisk performing popular art activities by using a variety of national and popular instruments.
					
					 Their repertoire included narration and chorus "We Have Become Red Flowers under Leader's Care", singing and story-telling "Worthwhile Is Our Life," dialogic poem "Aura in Spring", instrumental music and song "Arirang on Jiansanfeng," interlude "Mirror", chorus "Love Your Wives," group singing to the accompaniment of Janggu "It Is a Great Auspicious Event of the Country", kayagum ensemble "Road of Assisting Army," poem and chorus "Best Wishes."
					
					 The performers enthusiastically sang of the pride and honor of the Korean women dynamically pushing one of the two wheels of the revolutionary chariot under the Songun leadership of General Secretary Kim Jong Il, holding President Kim Il Sung in high esteem as the eternal sun of Juche.
					
					 The performance was enjoyed by officials of the women' union and its union members in Pyongyang.

articles.title: Spring Tree Planting Held
articles.content:
Spring Tree Planting Held
 Pyongyang, March 10 (KCNA) -- Spring tree planting of the Red Cross took place in Anhung-ri, Thaechon County of North Phyongan Province on Wednesday on the occasion of the period of the general mobilization for spring land management.
					 Present there were officials of the Red Cross Society of the DPRK, young RC members of the DPRK, the members of the delegation of the Norwegian Red Cross and the head of the delegation of the International Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies active in the DPRK.
					
					 The participants planted chestnut, pine-nut, acacia and other species of trees.
					
					 They appreciated an art performance given by the young RC members of the DPRK and went round several places including the sites of the construction now under way for the prevention of disasters with aid of the Norwegian Red Cross and the International Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies.

articles.title: Mass Physical Culture Brisk
articles.content:
Mass Physical Culture Brisk
Pyongyang, March 10 (KCNA) -- Physical culture has gained in popularity, drawing increasing public interest in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.
					 Kang Won Guk, an official of the Pyongyang Passenger and Freight Car Corps, told KCNA the atmosphere of sports activities pervades the corps.
					
					 Sports games are organized during breaks and in holidays in a diversified way so that everyone can take part in them, he said, adding:  
					
					 The regularly-organized sports games have brought about good results. 
					
					 We have always proved successful in sports contests held on the Ministry-of-Railways scale.
					
					 We also contributed to the ministry winning the male soccer event in the amateur group of the 11th National Games while Kim Song Jun, belonging to the corps, took the title in the 80kg category of the 7th National Ssirum (Korean wrestling) Tournament for Grand Bull Prize.    
					
					 The increasing interest in sports activities helps make the working place full of vigor and optimism and boost railway transport.

articles.title: Ethics of Korean Medical Workers
articles.content:
Ethics of Korean Medical Workers
 Pyongyang, March 10 (KCNA) -- It has become a commonplace in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea to devote oneself to others, with such noble practices being reported one after another in the country.
					 Early in January, a college student was sent to the Moranbong District People's Hospital, falling unconscious from a malignant disease.
					
					 The hospital took every possible measure, including oxygen inhalation, to save her life fading out minute by minute. But she fell into a toxic shock coupled with bleeding from some internal organs.
					
					 The hospital applied a scientific method of treatment to detoxify the patient as quickly as possible by raising her immunity while a lot of medical workers in the hospital donated their blood to her. As a result, the daughter of an ordinary worker could be brought back to life miraculously.
					
					 Early in July last year three female workers of the Ryongyang Mine had an accident to be injured seriously. They were carried by air to Pyongyang and put under the care of a powerful medical team.
					
					 With concussion of the brain, fractures of joints, ribs and pelvis and forehead laceration, they were at death's door. Pyongyang University of Medicine Teaching Hospital injected a large amount of blood and many kinds of medicines into them and conducted different examinations and checkups several times every day.
					
					 Thanks to devoted efforts of the medical workers they recovered their health.
					
					 Those in Pyongyang Municipal People's Hospital No. 2 and Haeju Municipal People's Hospital No. 1 in South Hwanghae Province, too, recently donated their flesh and blood to their patients with burns.
					
					 It is not a rare thing to hear such a story in the country. It is all attributable to the medical system established in the DPRK, where human life and health are considered more precious than anything else.

articles.title: US Accused of Working Hard to Launch Another Korean War
articles.content:
US Accused of Working Hard to Launch Another Korean War
 Pyongyang, March 10 (KCNA) -- The U.S. bellicose forces have recently decided to deliver a lot of ultra-modern sea patrol planes to south Korea within this year. The relevant measures are now being implemented. They claim that the deployment of such planes in south Korea is aimed at boosting what they call "combat capability," adding that this would render it possible to make long-range and precision strikes at the military targets of the DPRK. 
					 Rodong Sinmun Wednesday observes in a signed commentary carried in this regard:
					
					 This is a revelation of a war scenario of those who are keen to ignite another Korean war at any cost and put the whole of Korea under their control.
					
					 Through this war the U.S. imperialists seek to boost the offensive capability of the U.S. forces present in south Korea and the south Korean puppet forces and round off the preparations for a war.
					
					 Timed to coincide with the deployment of the above-said ultra-modern sea patrol planes, the U.S imperialists and the south Korean bellicose forces are staging madcap Key Resolve and Foal Eagle joint military exercises.
					
					 The U.S. bellicose forces describe the exercises as "annual drills" and " defensive ones" but this is nothing but hypocritical rhetoric intended to cover up the offensive and aggressive nature of the exercises and their danger.
					
					 The on-going exercises have rendered the situation on the Korean Peninsula so tense that it is beyond control and the military confrontation has gone into extremes.
					
					 The situation made it clearer that the U.S. is not in a position to ensure peace and realize denuclearization on the peninsula and build confidence between the DPRK and the U.S.
					
					 The U.S. is busy beefing up its forces and staging war exercises targeted at the dialogue partner while paying lip service to the "dialogue" with an axe to grind. This is nothing but crafty and brazenfaced double dealing tactics to achieve its criminal purpose with ease from a carrot-and-stick approach.
					
					 Noting that the situation is growing more serious due to the U.S. adventurous war racket, the commentary warns that the U.S. will be wholly to blame for the ensuing consequences.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun on Imminent Danger of Nuclear War
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun on Imminent Danger of Nuclear War
 Pyongyang, March 10 (KCNA) -- There is an imminent real danger of the outbreak of a nuclear war against the north on the Korean Peninsula owing to Key Resolve and Foal Eagle joint military exercises being staged by the U.S. imperialists and the south Korean bellicose forces.
					 Rodong Sinmun Wednesday says in a signed article in this regard:
					
					It is not hard to guess what disastrous consequences will be entailed by the attempt of one party to use force against the other party now that differing ideologies and systems exist and acute military confrontation persists in the north and the south, the article notes, and goes on:
					
					 The objective of the said joint military exercises is to examine the capability to conduct the operation for rapidly hurling the reinforcing huge U.S. forces into the Korean front from overseas and round off an adventurous nuclear war scenario to mount a surprise preemptive attack on the DPRK.
					
					 Therefore, no one can vouch that the on-going joint war maneuvers will not go over to an actual war to realize the above-said scenario.
					
					 If such war against the north breaks out, it will be none other than the Koreans who will suffer from it.
					
					 In order to prevent the danger of such war all the compatriots at home and abroad should unite close as one under the uplifted banner of peace against war and resolutely frustrate the south Korean conservative group's moves to escalate the confrontation with compatriots and launch a war of aggression against the north.
					
					 The DPRK sets store by the inter-Korean relations and desires the peace of the country, but does not beg for it. 
					
					 Aggressors and traitors keen to bring a war to the inviolable territory of the country, indifferent to the destiny of the nation, will not be able to escape a merciless punishment.
					
					 The south Korean conservative authorities would be well advised to stop running riot, properly understanding the strong will of the DPRK.

articles.title: Authorities' Anti-reunification Policy Flayed in S. Korea
articles.content:
Authorities' Anti-reunification Policy Flayed in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, March 10 (KCNA) -- Personages of different organizations in south Korea, including the South Side Committee for Implementing June 15 Joint Declaration, the Federation of Peasants Associations, the Committee for Independent Reunification of the Solidarity for Progress, the Headquarters of the Movement for One and the Same People and the Women's Solidarity, had interviews with People's Voice, an Internet broadcasting service, to denounce the puppet authorities' escalated anti-reunification confrontation policy.
					 They charged that the authorities have done nothing good in two years of their office and what is more serious in their crimes is that they have driven inter-Korean relations to a catastrophe.
					
					 They accused the authorities of having "selectively excluded" nongovernmental organizations of different strata from cooperation and exchange with the north including working contacts and disallowed their activities under various pretexts. 
					
					 Noting that the inter-Korean relations have reached the present worst phase over the past two years due to the authorities' Cold War conception, they warned that greater misfortune will befall in the future if such regime is allowed to stay any longer.
					
					 They stressed the need to carry on the struggle to thoroughly preserve and implement the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration despite any difficulties.

articles.title: Abuses of Women's Rights under Fire in S. Korea
articles.content:
Abuses of Women's Rights under Fire in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, March 10 (KCNA) -- 189 women's, civic and public, cultural and human rights organizations of south Korea, including the Federation of Women Organizations, held a rally at Ehwa Women's University on March 6 on the occasion of International Women's Day.
					 At the rally speakers charged that the present authorities are persistently pursuing a policy of discriminating against women by refusing to take any step against the daily growing decrease of the rate of women's participation in economic activities and employment.
					
					 They condemned the conservative ruling forces for widening the gap between the rich and the poor in society and violating the basic rights of the women.
					
					 A "March 8 women's declaration" was read out at the rally.
					
					 Gone are the days when the women lamented over their lot with folded arms, the declaration said, calling upon all the people to pool their efforts in the struggle to build a society where the women's rights are fully ensured.
					
					 It stressed that for the present they would wage a dynamic struggle to have the conservative ruling forces eliminated through the forthcoming "elections to local self-governing bodies" and get a correct policy on the women shaped.

articles.title: Stop to War Exercises Urged in S. Korea
articles.content:
Stop to War Exercises Urged in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, March 10 (KCNA) -- The Solidarity for Progress, the Confederation of Trade Unions, the People for Achieving Peace and Reunification and other civic and public organizations in south Korea jointly called a press conference outside the commanding post of the south Korea-U.S. "Combined Forces Command" on Monday, demanding a halt to the anti-DPRK joint military exercises.
					 Noting that the U.S. and the south Korean war maniacs finally kicked off Key Resolve and Foal Eagle joint military exercises, speakers at the conference branded them as a provocative act of blatantly going against the realization of peace in the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 The exercises, including drills for mountain warfare to help the U.S. and south Korean puppet troops familiarize themselves with the topography of the north, urban warfare, combined drill of marines and an exercise simulating a civilian-military operation in the area of the north, are aimed at invading it, to all intents and purposes, they pointed out.
					
					 They expressed the resolution to intensify such widespread struggle as rally and demonstration in protest against the war maneuvers.
					
					 On the same day organizations of various circles in Pusan, too, called a press conference to protest against the war exercises.

articles.title: Day of Sun Commemorated in Czech
articles.content:
Day of Sun Commemorated in Czech
 Pyongyang, March 10 (KCNA) -- A reading session on a work of General Secretary Kim Jong Il and seminar on his exploits were held in the Czech Republic on Mar. 4 on the occasion of the Day of the Sun.
					 Attending these events were personages of the Czech preparatory committee for commemorating the centenary of birth of President Kim Il Sung, the Paektusan Czech-Korean Friendship Association and the Czech Group for the Study and Materialization of the Juche Idea and popular masses.
					
					 Present on invitation were staff members of the DPRK embassy in this country.
					
					 At the events leader Kim Jong Il's work "Let Us Hold the Great Leader Comrade Kim Il Sung in High Esteem as Eternal President of Our Republic" was read out before a speech was made by Jaroslav Kafka, co-chairman of the preparatory committee.
					
					 Noting that Kim Il Sung, the prominent leader of the world socialist movement and labor movement, performed undying feats for the Korean revolution and the human cause of independence, the speaker said:
					
					 He is the benevolent liberator of Korea and the great leader who provided an independent and creative life to the Korean people.
					
					 He led the 15-year-long arduous anti-Japanese armed struggle to victory to liberate the Korean people from the Japanese imperialists' colonial rule and built in Korea a country whose masters are the popular masses.
					
					 Referring to the contributions made by Kim Il Sung to the development of the friendly relations between the two countries, the co-chairman said:
					
					 Kim Jong Il has devoted his all to adding brilliance to Kim Il Sung's idea and exploits forever.
					
					We wish the Korean people greater success in their work to preserve and glorify the exploits of 
						Kim Il Sung under the leadership of Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Story of Kim Jong Suk
articles.content:
Story of Kim Jong Suk
 Pyongyang, March 10 (KCNA) -- One day in December Juche 35 (1946) anti-Japanese heroine Kim Jong Suk told members of the guards a folktale.
					 In a village a lot of people had been hurt by a wolf.
					
					 A young villager, determined to go to kill the wolf, asked his younger brother to accompany him but the younger, afraid of the risk, failed to follow his elder.
					
					 So he discussed the matter with his best friend, who agreed to his plan instantly.
					
					 They fought the wolf at the risk of their lives and killed it at last.
					
					 A few days later, an old villager gave the young man a small bottle of magic liquor and advised him to share it with a person dearest to him.
					
					 The young man decided to share it with his friend who did a good thing for the villagers together with him.
					
					 Concluding the tale, Kim Jong Suk said it gave a lesson that more valuable than kinsmen was a person sharing the same will and purpose and that relationship between parents and children, between brothers and between sisters would be further consolidated only when they had the same will and purpose in revolutionary activities.

articles.title: Ofrecida funcion conjunta de la UMDC
articles.content:
Ofrecida funcion conjunta de la UMDC
Pyongyang, 10 de marzo (ATCC) -- Tuvo lugar del dia 7 al 9 en el Gran Teatro de Pyongyang la funcion conjunta del XVII Festival Artistico Nacional de la Union de Mujeres Democraticas de Corea.
					Las ejecutantes demostraron plenamente sus talentos cultivados en el proceso de sus actividades culturales y artisticas masivas que libraron utilizando varios instrumentos musicales populares inclusive los tradicionales de la nacion coreana.
					
					En la escena se presentaron la narracion y coro "Florece de pleno en el regazo del Lider", el canto homofono y narracion "Nuestra vida es hermosa", el poema en dialogo "Perfume de la primavera", la musica instrumental y cancion "Arirang resuena en Jiansanfeng", el entreacto "Espejo", el coro "Amen", la cancion acompanada de Janggo "Gran jubilo nacional", la cancion con acompanamiento de Kayagum "Camino de ayuda al ejercito", el poema y coro "Nuestro deseo" y otras piezas.
					
					Ellas describieron el orgullo y la dignidad de las mujeres coreanas que empujan una rueda de la revolucion bajo la direccion del Songun del Dirigente Kim Jong Il enalteciendo como eterno Sol del Juche al Presidente Kim Il Sung.
					
					Disfrutaron la funcion las funcionarias de la UMDC y las gremiales capitalinas de esta entidad.

articles.title: Acto de plantacion de arboles de estacion primaveral de cruz roja
articles.content:
Acto de plantacion de arboles de estacion primaveral de cruz roja
Pyongyang, 10 de marzo (ATCC) -- Tuvo lugar el dia 10 en la comuna de Anhung del distrito de Thaechon de la provincia de Phyong-an del Norte el acto de plantacion de arboles de la estacion primaveral de la cruz roja en ocasion del periodo de la movilizacion general para la administracion territorial primaveral.
					Participaron en el acto los funcionarios de la Asociacion de la Cruz Roja de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, los miembros de la Asociacion de la Cruz Roja de Jovenes y Ninos, los integrantes de la delegacion de la Sociedad de la Cruz Roja de Noruega y el jefe de la delegacion de la Federacion Internacional de Sociedades de la Cruz Roja y la Medialuna Roja que trabaja en Corea.
					
					Los participantes trasplantaron el castano, el pino pinonero, la acacia y otros arboles. 
					
					En la ocasion los participantes asistieron a una funcion artistica de los miembros de la Asociacion de la Cruz Roja de Jovenes y Ninos y recorrieron los terrenos de obras para la prevencion de desastres que se libran en cooperacion con la Sociedad de la Cruz Roja de Noruega y la Federacion Internacional de Sociedades de la Cruz Roja y la Medialuna Roja y otros lugares.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun denuncia a EE.UU. que busca segunda guerra coreana
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun denuncia a EE.UU. que busca segunda guerra coreana
Pyongyang, 10 de marzo (ATCC) -- Recientemente, los belicistas estadounidenses decidieron entregar dentro de este ano al Sur de Corea muchos aviones patrulleros del mar equipados con la tecnologia de punta.
					En cuanto a esta decision que ya se pone en practica, los enemigos la describen como medida para "ampliar la combatividad" y dicen que esto posibilitara el ataque a precision y de largo alcance contra los objetos militares de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea. 
					
					Al respecto, el rotativo Rodong Sinmun difundio este miercoles un comentario individual que senala asi:
					
					Tal medida revela la siniestra intencion de ellos que estan locos por ocupar a toda Corea al provocar a toda costa la segunda guerra coreana en la Peninsula Coreana. 
					
					Al ponerla en practica, los imperialistas estadounidenses pretenden elevar la capacidad ofensiva de sus tropas ocupantes del Sur de Corea y del ejercito titere surcoreano y perfeccionar los preparativos de guerra. 
					
					Coincidiendo con ello, los imperialistas norteamericanos libran con los belicistas surcoreanos los freneticos simulacros conjuntos "Key Resolve" y "Aguilucho".
					
					Aunque ellos los califican de "anuales" y de "defensivos", esto no pasa de ser una farsa para ocultar su caracter ofensivo, agresivo y peligroso.
					
					Debido a los "Key Resolve" y "Aguilucho", la situacion de la Peninsula Coreana se halla en la fase "incontrolable" y la confrontacion militar llega al punto limite. 
					
					Esta vez quedo evidenciado que EE.UU. no esta para preservar la paz y realizar la desnuclearizacion de la Peninsula Coreana ni para construir la confianza con Corea. 
					
					El acto imprudente de EE.UU., que detras de la cortina del "dialogo" intensifica los ejercicios belicos y el aumento armamentista contra la contraparte del dialogo, parte de su astuta tactica de doble rasero para alcanzar facilmente sus objetivos criminales con la zanahoria en una mano y con el garrote en la otra. 
					
					Los aventureros alborotos de guerra de EE.UU. complican mas la situacion. 
					
					Toda la responsabilidad de las consecuencias de ello recaera sobre EE.UU.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun califica de peligro real la guerra anti-RPDC
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun califica de peligro real la guerra anti-RPDC 
Pyongyang, 10 de marzo (ATCC) -- Debido a los ejercicios militares conjuntos "Key Resolve" y "Aguilucho" iniciados por los imperialistas norteamericanos y los belicistas surcoreanos, el estallido de la guerra nuclear de agresion a la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea deviene en la Peninsula Coreana un inminente peligro real.
					 Asi senala el diario Rodong Sinmun en un articulo individual de este miercoles y prosigue:
					
					Puesto que existen las ideas y regimenes diferentes en el Norte y el Sur y ambas partes estan en aguda confrontacion militar, no es dificil imaginar que consecuencias se produciran si una parte intenta atacar con las fuerzas a la contraparte.
					
					 El objetivo de los simulacros arriba mencionados reside en revisar la capacidad operacional para trasladar y desplegar rapidamente en el frente coreano a las colosales tropas norteamericanas de refuerzo procedentes de ultramar y en perfeccionar el guion de aventurera guerra nuclear para atacar de manera sorpresiva y preventiva a la RPDC.
					
					 Por eso, no hay ninguna garantia de que esos ejercicios conjuntos no pasaran a la guerra de verdad.
					
					 Si se desencadena la guerra de agresion a la RPDC, la nacion coreana sera la victima de ella.
					
					 Para prevenir el inminente peligro de guerra, todos los coreanos deben unirse firmemente en un haz con la bandera de la paz contra la guerra en alto para frustrar rotundamente las maniobras de los compinches conservadores del Sur de Corea encaminadas a la confrontacion fratricida y la guerra anti-RPDC.
					
					 La RPDC aprecia las relaciones Norte-Sur y desea la paz del pais, pero nunca las mendiga.
					
					 Seran condenados al implacable castigo los agresores y los traidores vendepatrias que actuan desesperadamente para desatar la guerra en la sagrada tierra patria sin tomar en cuenta el destino de la nacion.
					
					 Las autoridades conservadoras surcoreanas deben portarse con prudencia justipreciando la voluntad resuelta de la RPDC.
